title: Voice to text message. A message appears when attempting to use Voice-to-text
content:
Updated OS, and apps
restarted phone...still happens
Voice-to-text works fine on most apps, but on at least one app the following message appears:
"Voice typing
To use voice input, you must download and install Google Voice Search"
Of course, it is installed and it works fine in other apps.
The app I know Voice-to-text error message appears in is Microsoft Outlook.
It has failed to enter any text while otherwise appearing to work without a message in other apps.
In the Amazon web page on Chrome the voice window opens and my words appear in the window but are not entered into the Amazon search bar.
The same thing happens in the eBay web page...and on every other webpage using Chrome with a text entry bar.
Firefox is also not getting any output from the Google Voice window.
Microsoft Edge will receive output but web pages open in Edge do not get the text output.
Gmail appears to use its own keyboard (not Swiftkey) and receives the Voice-to-text data from the last failed app.

Anybody else having similar problems or a solution?
